traceability.evidence: • CLI flag parsing: src/cli-options-helpers.js supports --prod-min-age, --dev-min-age, --prod-severity, --dev-severity with validation; covered by test/cli-options-helpers.test.js (parseProdMinAgeFlag, parseDevMinAgeFlag, parseProdSeverityFlag, parseDevSeverityFlag). • Fallback & default: parseOptions in src/cli-options.js uses general --min-age/--severity when prod/dev flags absent; test/cli.flags.test.js verifies that --min-age sets both prod and dev thresholds and that default values are applied. • Config file support: src/config-loader.js reads config.prod and config.dev with keys minAge and minSeverity; test/cli.config-file.test.js verifies reading nested prod/dev values and that CLI flags override config. • Dependency-type detection: loadPackageJson + buildRows set depType to 'prod' or 'dev' based on package.json; test/printOutdated.prodDependency.test.js asserts 'prod' for prodDeps, and test/printOutdated.test.js asserts 'dev' fallback. • Output indication: printOutdated (src/print-outdated.js) prints a "Type" column in table output, and xmlFormatter (src/xml-formatter.js) emits for each package; tests in test/printOutdated*.test.js and test/xml-formatter.thresholds.test.js cover this. • Precedence & validation: Specific CLI flags > general flags > config > defaults; invalid values exit with code 2 (tested in cli-options-helpers and cli.flags), validating the full acceptance criteria.
traceability.notes: All ten acceptance criteria are satisfied by the existing implementation and covered by unit and integration tests, demonstrating full support for separate production and development thresholds.
